comment._content: Louis Harvy Chalif wrote such books as "Russian Festivals and Costumes for Pageant and Dance" (1921) and "The Chalif Textbook of Dancing," which can both be found on Googlebooks. His career is discussed in Mirjana Lausevic, Balkan Fascination: Creating an Alternative Music Culture in America (Oxford UP 2007): 95-105. He seems to have been involved somewhat with the settlement movement's efforts to include folk culture and physical activity in urban education; he died in 1948.

comment._content:
The dancers' costumes here resemble Greek national folk attire, or even historic Greek military costume. Richard, in his Wikipedia entry, notes that in 1920 Chalif published a book on Greek dancing.

Chalif's advertisement in the New-York Tribune (November 24, 1912) emphasized that he taught "Classical and Esthetic Greek and National Dancing."
